definition[0]: the total amount of SHARE CAPITAL and debt that a company has and uses
example[0]: The oil company is faced with doubling the capital employed in its refining and marketing business to £6 billion in the next 10 years.
definition[1]: a company’s profit for a particular year in relation to its capital; RETURN ON CAPITAL
example[1]: Its return on capital invested was 31%, putting it in the same league as other big food companies.
example[2]: The company has a return on capital employed of 19.25%, the highest in the Indian sugar industry.
